reviews.review_msg: He is really helpful when you ask a question! He gets patient!!!
He is a great guy...just get to know him and makes sure he remembers who you are and in the end it'll he'll help if you are willing to learn

I remember taking Econ 331 with him in the late 90's.  He gave some lecture about having cell phones turned off and not being late to his lecture.  What a total hypocrit, he was always late, showed up to class all sweaty and he looked like he was going to have a heart attack.  He stared people down that were late even though he was too.

Great prof in comparison to your other choices for this class... Good guy, knows his stuff for sure. This class is a requirement for an honours degree for a reason.  You need to take the time to UNDERSTAND the concepts if you want to do well.  Ask for help if you need it. o/w don't expect to get above avg.

He wont teach you what you actyually need to know for his Finals. On top of this, he tends to favor a couple people in class and be lenient to them while letting the rest suffer. Not flexible on exam marking.

His mid-terms and finals were MUCH more challenging that the lectures indicated. For some reason our final was much more difficult than to those he has given in the past.  Also, the TAs were of little help. This is a MATH course, NOT and Econ course, proceed with caution.

Wow he threw so many curve balls at us in the midterms and finals. The practice finals were nothing like what we got. Heck a few questions on the final he might have only discussed for 30 seconds. Concave utility function? wtf?!? He must have went easy on those guys below.
Will never ever take a Wainwright course again..,would rather delay graduation.  If you must take this course try for other instructor. dGPA/dWainwright <0
No Comments

OMG, I don't remember if this was a requirement or not for a non-honors econ degree... but it is the most boring piece of crap ever!!!  I really really really really hated this course!  Advoid at all costs!  OTOH, the prof isn't too boring... but his notes are not extremely helpful.. all examples, not much you can get out of them while studying.

Attention to those majoring in Econ, this course is a must take. Impossible to get a F, midterm was hard but the final was super easy, as long as you got his past finals and actually work on them, you will get an A.. Mark my word for it.

Final easy as hell.. Identical questions as he posted on the website... Thank god i got past  answer keys for the final... and I ended up with an A from a C midterm... Strongly recommeded for GPA booster....
an interesting class

His lectures are definitely related to the mt/finals, but working on his past midterms/finals are WAY more important. The whole final was pretty much recycled questions from his posted past finals! Tutorials are basically useless, so don't bother except handing in the homeworks.

Overall, I found him comprehensive. You may notice he gives you "hints" what's on the exams but they don't appear. Midterm average was 51%. Math majors taking this course might not find it as easy as they might think. Final exam was fair.
GOOD prof.  little notes and easy midterms but HARD FINAL!!! but still worth a take~!
Not very focused, always late. Gives impression doesn't care about teaching.
the laziest teacher ever, little lecture notes, what I liked most was that he's always late and leave early.
Final exam is a little bit unpredictable, but overall it is an easy credit.
No frills, no surprises. He won't offer much beyond the basics, but he does the basics well.
No Comments
a very mean professor
Extremely easy course!
very hard exams, but if u have previous exam then it's not the case

Her final is so much harder than the given exercises and examples. It is not really relevant to the practice exam. You will need to prepare to know literally everything in the materials when she said "cumulative"

it is a 5 credit courses, but not that difficult. attend in class, listen and make some notes in class and do the assignment  you will be fine. not really difficult to understand. she explained very well. even you do not understand the concepts, just review the examples in class, it is really easy  course.

Took it with her this semester. She's a very nice professor if you ask her for help. Although econ 331 is a tough course for sure, you really need to do a lot of practice from you textbook to get a good grade. People gave up doing an honor degree after taking 331. Be prepared and do not freak out.

She has a very unlikeable attitude towards her students. She once said in class that "the first person who solves the problem the fastest will win my respect." This type of comment shows that she looks down on those who aren't the best and the brightest. Furthermore, her assignments are disconnected from the examples she gave in class.

The class is a bit challenging but it is scaled heavily in the end. She is a very helpfull teacher that wants students to do well but the amount of correlation between the examples in class and what was on the exam is extremly low. Betile always offers good tips on how to solve assigment problems.
She is very organized and very helpful. highly recommended if you are going to graduate school.
This is not an easy course. Recommend look over the past midterms and finals for the assignments and exams

econ 331: tutorial questions are for helping the assignment. I didnot go over the whole note/tutorial questions. If you pick the important stuff, it will only require you to spend less than 6 hours for studying midterm+final. The assignment took lots of time though. they worth 20%. I never use the textbook throughout the course, and end up with B+.

For heaven sake Bertille is damn sexy IMO! She's young and has a passion for this material. Although she is very helpful and promptly answers emails, her lack of teaching skills overshadows the former. That will probably get better over time though. Bottom line, the course is extremely difficult and requires that you be an expert in calc. Enjoy!

Bertille's lecture notes are very clear and concise. Always answers her emails within a day or less. Extremely helpful and super easy to understand. Its a tough course if you're not proficient at math, but she does an awesome job of making it as easy as possible. Bad reviews are undoubtedly from slackers/students who didnt read the course descript

her handwriting is clear, and she replies emails in time, seems that she is always there to help students. Someone might think this course is so hard and the prof is bad, while I think it is due to their bad attitudes. If you are really hardworking, you will get what you want.
Of all the professors I have had she was the worst. Do yourself a favor - if you want that honors degree take the course substitutes through the math dept.

Bertille is relatively new at teaching but she says herself that she is getting easier on her students.  Here is the thing.  This class is hard no matter what.  It is a 5 credit Math course.  If your good at math, take this course for credit. If your not, DON'T DO IT.  You have to seriously practice your stuff over and over.  Forget falling behind!
I know you are smart and young, but you are lack of experience in teaching, try to improve okay. Overall, she's not a good prof at all, don't take this class if you want the credits.

hard econ course with a lot of math.  need to do a lot of practices from the textbook in order to get good grades b/c she will take some questions from the textbook for her finals.  won't suggest it if you are not good with math(calculas).

Be prepared to copy down notes from overhead.... seriously lots. She didn't even make up her own hw assignments, she just copied them from somewhere else. Then she made up a final where stuff wasn't even taught on.

This course bans calculators, but after Test 1 (linear algebra), you won't need one. He shares more practice problems as the term goes on. He's passionate about econ and open to talk beyond the course. It's not pure mathâ€”more like thinking mathematically in an econ way, great for students without strong math background.
Overall, I would recommend Professor Freeman to anyone looking to deepen their understanding of economics in a challenging yet manageable course.

David lives inside his own head. He thinks he is brilliant yet the majority of his slides include structural errors that throw the class on a loop. There are frequent errors in his slides and lectures as he arrives to class unprepared. While I received strong grades in the course, it was due to reading the textbook - his lectures were useless

A super open-minded and super nice professor!! It is not hard to follow his pace in class as long as you concentrate, understanding practice questions in lectures and tutorials are essential. Exams are similar to sample exams. Honestly, he didn't complicate this course. Very patient with students! My favorite professor in SFU!!!
impossibly long exams, very difficult content, does not scale grades

Thank god i took akbar on my last sem, 331 i failed 2 midterms and still ended up with B-...Do not expect him to teach u anything...read the text instead, bcoz his assignments, exam questions are pretty much from the text...KEEP IN MIND THAT IF YOU WANT TO JUST AIM FOR A PASSING GRADE, TAKE AKBAR, he doesn't fail anybody, nor as giving a D to u..

Definitely under-rated. A good, solid professor. Econ 331 was a good class. Personally, I don't understand why so many people have indicted Akbar for his accent; I'm a run-of-the mill English speaker and I didn't find his accent difficult at all. In fact, he was pretty clear.
